## Description {#details}

A class representing a position in a <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/dataextractor">DataExtractor</a>, as well as any error encountered during extraction.

It enables one to extract a sequence of values without error-checking and then checking for errors in bulk at the end. The class holds an <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/error">Error</a> object, so failing to check the result of the parse will result in a runtime error. The error flag is sticky and will cause all subsequent extraction functions to fail without even attempting to parse and without updating the <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/dataextractor/cursor">Cursor</a> offset. After clearing the error flag, one can again use the <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/dataextractor/cursor">Cursor</a> object for parsing.

Definition at line 54 of file <a href="/docs/api/files/include/include/llvm/include/llvm/support/dataextractor-h">DataExtractor.h</a>.

Checks whether the cursor is valid (i.e.

no errors were encountered). In case of errors, this does not clear the error flag â€“ one must call <a href="#a3453d69f4b4b74c0cf69808bc7d1c8b0">takeError()</a> instead.

### tell() {#a22c134bb6de5493faf9c7076ef4dfcac}

<MemberDefinition
  prototype={<>uint64&#95;t llvm::DataExtractor::Cursor::tell () const</>}
  labels = {["inline"]}>
Return the current position of this <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/dataextractor/cursor">Cursor</a>.

In the error state this is the position of the <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/dataextractor/cursor">Cursor</a> before the first error was encountered.
